A lightweight validation plugin

the configuration
Returns a new validation group on the subject
comment.returns: A ValidationGroup that encapsulates the validation rules and current validation state for this subject

comment.shortText: Encapsulates validation rules and their current validation state for a given subject
Instantiates a new {ValidationGroup}
Instantiates a new {ValidationGroup}
The subject to evaluate
The observerLocator used to monitor changes on the subject
The configuration
Adds a validation rule that allows a value to be empty/null
comment.returns: returns this ValidationGroup, to enable fluent API

comment.shortText:
Specifies that the next validation rules only need to be evaluated when the caseLabel matches the value returned by a preceding switch statement
See: switch(conditionExpression)
comment.returns: returns this ValidationGroup, to enable fluent API

comment.shortText: Adds a validation rule that checks a value for containing not a single whitespace
comment.returns: returns this ValidationGroup, to enable fluent API

comment.shortText: Adds a validation rule that checks a value for only containing alphanumerical characters
comment.returns: returns this ValidationGroup, to enable fluent API

comment.shortText: Adds a validation rule that checks a value for only containing alphanumerical characters or whitespace
comment.returns: returns this ValidationGroup, to enable fluent API

comment.shortText: Adds a validation rule that checks a value for being strictly numeric, this excludes formatted numbers like '-3,600.25'
comment.returns: returns this ValidationGroup, to enable fluent API

comment.shortText:
Specifies that the next validation rules only need to be evaluated when not other caseLabel matches the value returned by a preceding switch statement
See: switch(conditionExpression)
comment.returns: returns this ValidationGroup, to enable fluent API

comment.shortText:
Specifies that the next validation rules only need to be evaluated when the previously specified conditionExpression is false.
See: if (conditionExpression, threshold)
comment.returns: returns this ValidationGroup, to enable fluent API

comment.shortText:
Specifies that the execution of next validation rules no longer depend on the the previously specified conditionExpression.
See: if (conditionExpression, threshold)
comment.returns: returns this ValidationGroup, to enable fluent API

comment.shortText:
Specifies that the execution of next validation rules no longer depend on the the previously specified conditionExpression.
See: switch(conditionExpression)
comment.returns: returns this ValidationGroup, to enable fluent API

comment.shortText: Adds a validation property for the specified path
comment.returns: returns this ValidationGroup, to enable fluent API

comment.text: the path of the property/field, for example 'firstName' or 'address.muncipality.zipCode'

comment.shortText: Adds a validation rule that checks a value for having a length greater than or equal to a specified threshold and less than another threshold
comment.returns: returns this ValidationGroup, to enable fluent API

comment.shortText: Adds a validation rule that checks a value for having a length less than a specified threshold
comment.returns: returns this ValidationGroup, to enable fluent API

comment.shortText: Adds a validation rule that checks a value for having a length greater than or equal to a specified threshold
comment.returns: returns this ValidationGroup, to enable fluent API

comment.shortText: Specifies that the next validation rules only need to be evaluated when the specified conditionExpression is true
comment.returns: returns this ValidationGroup, to enable fluent API

comment.text: a function that returns true of false.
an optional treshold object that is passed to the conditionExpression

comment.shortText: Adds a validation rule that checks a value for being greater than or equal to a threshold, and less than or equal to another threshold
comment.returns: returns this ValidationGroup, to enable fluent API

comment.shortText: Adds a validation rule that checks a value for being a valid isEmail address
comment.returns: returns this ValidationGroup, to enable fluent API

comment.shortText: Adds a validation rule that checks a value for being equal to a threshold
comment.returns: returns this ValidationGroup, to enable fluent API

comment.text: Optional: a label to use in the validation message

comment.shortText: Adds a validation rule that checks a value for being greater than a threshold
comment.returns: returns this ValidationGroup, to enable fluent API

comment.shortText: Adds a validation rule that checks a value for being greater than or equal to a threshold
comment.returns: returns this ValidationGroup, to enable fluent API

comment.shortText: Adds a validation rule that checks a value for being equal to at least one other value in a particular collection
comment.returns: returns this ValidationGroup, to enable fluent API

comment.shortText: Adds a validation rule that checks a value for being less than or equal to a threshold
comment.returns: returns this ValidationGroup, to enable fluent API

comment.shortText: Adds a validation rule that checks a value for being less than a threshold
comment.returns: returns this ValidationGroup, to enable fluent API

comment.shortText: Adds a validation rule that checks a value for being 'isNotEmpty', 'required'
comment.returns: returns this ValidationGroup, to enable fluent API

comment.shortText: Adds a validation rule that checks a value for not being equal to a threshold
comment.returns: returns this ValidationGroup, to enable fluent API

comment.text: Optional: a label to use in the validation message

comment.shortText: Adds a validation rule that checks a value for being numeric, this includes formatted numbers like '-3,600.25'
comment.returns: returns this ValidationGroup, to enable fluent API

comment.shortText: Adds a validation rule that checks a value for being a strong password. A strong password contains at least the specified of the following groups: lowercase characters, uppercase characters, digits and special characters.
comment.returns: returns this ValidationGroup, to enable fluent API

comment.text: Optionally, specifiy the number of groups to match. Default is 4.

comment.shortText: Adds a validation rule that checks a value for being a valid URL
comment.returns: returns this ValidationGroup, to enable fluent API

comment.shortText: Adds a validation rule that checks a value for matching a particular regex
comment.returns: returns this ValidationGroup, to enable fluent API

comment.shortText: Adds a validation rule that checks a value for passing a custom function
comment.returns: returns this ValidationGroup, to enable fluent API

comment.text: The custom function that needs to pass, that takes two arguments: newValue (the value currently being evaluated) and optionally: threshold, and returns true/false.
An optional threshold that will be passed to the customFunction

comment.shortText: Adds the {ValidationRule}
comment.returns: returns this ValidationGroup, to enable fluent API

comment.text: The rule that needs to pass

comment.shortText: Specifies that the next validation rules only need to be evaluated when they are preceded by a case that matches the conditionExpression
comment.returns: returns this ValidationGroup, to enable fluent API

comment.text: a function that returns a case label to execute. This is optional, when omitted the case label will be matched using the underlying property's value

comment.shortText: Causes complete re-evaluation: gets the latest value, marks the property as 'dirty' (unless false is passed), runs validation rules asynchronously and updates this.result
comment.returns: A promise that fulfils when valid, rejects when invalid.

comment.shortText: Specifies that the execution of the previous validation rule should use the specified error message if it fails
comment.returns: returns this ValidationGroup, to enable fluent API

comment.text: either a static string or a function that takes two arguments: newValue (the value that has been evaluated) and threshold.

comment.shortText: returns a promise that fulfils and resolves to true/false
Validation rules: return a promise that fulfills and resolves to true/false
Returns a promise that fulfils and resolves to simple result status object.
